isis.stitle: ANTILOCK MODULATOR ASSEMBLY: BENDIX M-21 AND M-22 - OPERATION - ANTILOCK OPERATION - GENERAL

svcproc.title: ANTILOCK OPERATION - GENERAL
svcproc.para: If a service brake application is made and the antilock system detects an impending wheel lockup, the antilock controller will immediately begin modification of the brake application using the modulator.

To modify the brake application, the coils of the two solenoid valves contained in the modulator are energized or de-energized in a pre-programmed sequence by the antilock controller. When a solenoid coil is energized, a shuttle within the solenoid moves, and depending upon the function of the specific solenoid, it either opens or closes, thereby causing the exhaust or re-application of air pressure to the brake actuator. The solenoids in the modulator are controlled independently by the antilock controller. By opening and closing the solenoid valves in the modulator, the antilock controller is able to simulate what the driver does when he "pumps the brakes." It must be remembered, however, that unlike the driver, the antilock controller is able to "pump" each modulator, along with the brakes connected to it, independently and with far greater speed and accuracy.
